comments.body:
Animation for mining  can be improved

And hitting

And add sitting
Ok

I think Minecraft's rigid and simple animations are part of it's charm, especially for players.

I do, however, think some mob animations could be lightly updated, as newer mobs like Striders and Sniffers, while having simple animations that don't look out of place, are certainly nicer to look at when compared to animations on older mobs. I think if older mobs had their animations updated to be more on-par with them it could do some good.
Would be nice for animals to run a bit more natural and for zombies to trudge around to make the game feel more alive. I upvoted and I hope this will become a feature soon!
I agree entirely.
I agree with the walking, running, and swimming but the trees don’t really need an animation (like falling down when cut ). I only say this because I can’t imagine a Minecraft with physics :)
you have a good idea
Exactly what I was thinking. If they’re going to add armor trims, then why not goall the way for expressing yourself with tool trims!

I believe that we should be able to change the models of armor, tools and weapons with an impact on performance. For example, an ordinary helmet can be converted into a helmet with a visor, which will worsen visibility, but increase the protection area. Or reforge the sword into a saber, which will increase the attack speed, but reduce damage to armored targets.

Since the surface area of tools has fewer pixels than that of armor, trying to fit a pattern would be nearly impossible. Instead, you could just add a basic strip of the desired color along the edge of the handle, blade, etc. Adding trim to a tool should not require a template: you would simply put the weapon and the ingot/mineral of choice in the smithing table.
Considering how many pixels there are on tools, there probably should be an independent template for tools that adds a single design.

As much as I love this idea, I think there's only one design that comes to mind for me, being through a swirl sort of design which is a bit thin so the original material is still noticeable. Any other ideas on this?

It would be super useful even just to be able to change the wood of the tool.

Being able to distinguish between my fortune and silktouch pick is awkward if I don't keep one as a diamond variant.
THIS IS A GRRREAT IDEA HOPE IT Gets IN THE GAME
What if, along with the armour trims and upgrade template they added "armour modifications". They could change the shape of an armour piece like you mentioned.

*a technoblade reference* maybe?

anyways great idea

I want a gold crown but you could trim when you craft, use 3 gold helmets so it’s more durable and what ever gems you use in crafting would show up. I use a gold helmet in the nether and it breaks to often with mending and unbreaking
Makes more sense to just craft a crown. A trim doesn't alter overall shape, just adds to existing shapes.

actually, this a good ideia, those kind of villager could be gardeners or botanical (vegetal biologists), once we don't got any occupation like this in-game. They could sell saplings, flowers, bone meal, and attached to it the devs would had the change of bringing more features around crops and plants in general.
It would be really neat to have beekeeper villagers, wouldn't it? Especially since honey and honeycomb is becoming such a useful part of the game.
No, they're intentionally missing due to inspiring players to build them instead. Also, MC is mostly devoid of real-world culture.
This in itself would add more self-representation and storytelling to the game.
Farming is not as much as a big part of the game as it should be
we need more farming and like you get xp from making better crops

I agree with this 100%. Minecraft is overdue for a food system overhaul.

There needs to be more crops then the ones we currently have. Like tomatos, peanuts, or even rice. Maybe even a culinary work station which will allow us to make new food recipes.

New biomes like an oasis biome found within deserts that have palm trees with coconuts or maybe allow us to get bananas from jungle trees.

An extension to this idea is that maybe we should actually see the fruits on the actual leaves than have it drop with rng. Or maybe we could have both.

Another idea is different berry types than just the sweet berry like blueberries and strawberries. Currently sweet berries are a bit generic and could encourage that all berries are safe to eat. When that is not true as there are poisonous berry types like night shade and holly berries.

Finally give frogs a chance to drop frog legs, currently the rabbit leg is used to make the jumping potion, however I feel like it should be used to make the unobtainable in survival Luck Effect. And that frog legs give us the jump boost effect instead.

In conclusion, please give us a food system update/overhaul.
This would be great, shame that they aren’t adding more features to 1.20, fingers crossed something like this is in 1.21
#Cherry#CherryPie#CherrySprinklesToExplainWhyCakeHasRed#CherryGrowsOnTree#AppleGrowsOnTree#Corn
I totally agree! Pears, Bananas, Oranges, Strawberries, Blueberries, Corn, Lettuce, Tomatoes, Onions, Cabbage, Rice, Oats, Nuts. Definitely a lot more!
A cool idea but I think we may have all the wood variants we’ll ever need after 1.20!
Good idea

New wood types are fun parts of each update that add variety to builds. I like the sniffer finding new decorative flowers and staying with that role. I really like when you can experience new biomes like the cherry blossom and mangrove swamp that also give you new wood. I like how Mojang is encouraging exploration and discovery in this update and hope to see them roll out future updates like this as well.
Also add azalea wood types, and, Ta-da! 4 new woods in one update?? Minecraft 1.20: Tree update coming soon!
make it huge. It has to be huge. Bigger than the jungle tree. That's how ancient trees are
Hey, the one color of wood we don't have yet: green.

In mega taiga biomes, sniffers could find giant redwood saplings. These trees don’t have to have a new wood type, could just use mangrove logs in a 3x3 or even 6x6 (4 saplings together) trunk size, growing up to 80 blocks tall.

In prehistoric times, some trees had green diamond-scale bark and were also huge, which could be a way to bring naturally green wood to minecraft.

(Lepidodendrons, one of the first trees on earth)

This would be good for players without capes who cant get one to customize their elytra with trims. I do think it should work with players elytras who are wearing capes so they can customize and match their cape'd elytra to the trim and match colors, then everyone can enjoy the trim with or without a cape.
I think it should use already existing templates, not specifically elytra templates, so you wouldn't have even more templates but just for 1 item
Yes carpets, no storage.
These won't happen since camels have their own unique features, while the other mounts have their own unique features.

I wish Camels had more ways to customize them. Horses can wear armor (and leather horse armor can be dyed) as well as chest, Llamas have carpets and different colors.

Can we at least have different colored camel variants such as the darker brown, yellow, tan, and white (albino) so they aren't all just the same?

Having the storage would outclass the donkeys and llamas, and I'm pretty sure the devs already said no to that...as for the carpets, that would technically be stealing the llama's gimmick as well, but since its only cosmetic I don't think it matters too much.
carpets instead of saddles would add to the customization 1.20 features, as well as being more realistic.
That's such a great ideia!!

This creature, unlike usual snow or iron golems, is something that has no main feature, it’s long arms can hold deepslate and tuff, sometimes they are found with suspicious gravel, what could this mean, and were they around when these strange ruins were built?
I think this sounds super cool! The Trail Ruins could definitely use some additional features and this could be cool
And Copper Golem in trial chambers, where you only can get it there like a statue, and then you would be able to remove oxidation.
let it be tamed
I think you would want to have it look different then the iron Golem or the snow golem
I think you would want to have it look different then the iron Golem or the snow golem
It should be called something else or be another golem because the tuff golem was already in Mob Vote 2022

it is a weird coincidence that the two mob votes before the 1.21 update had a copper and tuff golem, the primary blocks for the trial chamber. but this would remove the point of voting for one mob if the others may be added anyway.
need this

I think the sound would be so pretty! the bamboo lyre instrument feels like an instrument that would fit perfectly with minecrafts mellow, cheery or somber sound. I can already imagine all the beautiful songs people could make with the sound

As someone who has played a lyre, it would look great, a sound has not been added for a long time for the musical block, although I think it would be a little extra, there are similar sounds but that detail would be nice
This coloration could also carry on to the Chisled bookshelves. What If I wanted to make a lovecraftian lair with interactive black books & other mysterious decorations? this could do just that?
It should be able to allow any color, similar to leather armor. You could also wash off the color with a cauldron too.
Imagine being able to dye raw leather. To me that just makes sense, since leather armor can be dyed. Then we could dye then craft, or craft then dye, just like with colored beds.

Yes to dyeable books, but no to having them appear visually in chiseled bookshelves. That would require an absurd number of textures and blockstates for every single color combination for all six book slots. That would be a LOT. Unless they found some other method from what they've been doing (which don't get me wrong, they probably could find a better way), it would simply be too much work for something so insignificant (like having multiple candles in one block).

Lecterns should be simple enough to do though.
perhaps also remove the enchantment effect on finished ones, and have it have some sort of bookmark that shows that it's a signed book and not a regular book item

I just had this idea too. I'm glad someone else thought of it but it doesn't seem to have gotten enough attention to be added to the update since as of writing this the pre release has come out sadly. I sometimes have multiple books and quills for notes I take about my project and it would be nice to be able to distinguish them quickly. And yes it would be awesome if they were on bookshelves as the color they were!!
thought of this when looking at the recipe book, itd be sweet
Eso sí le hace falta a Minecraft
I think that this could be a way to make finding suspicious sand harder to brush and collect loot.
Yeah. It could be like the powder snow.
I’m against this idea. We already have powdered snow, and it’s already a pain to deal with the powdered snow in the first place.

Maybe instead of just quick sand, there could be flowing sand, flowing mud etc.  Where sponges can be used to turn flowing sand/mud into regular sand/mud, then simply placing the sponges next to heat sources like lava to instantly dry them out. This could be useful if implemented in a way that makes sense.

The base idea of quicksand being implemented is neat. It gives a new treath to biomes like the desert or savanna.

If mojang would be interested in implementing it I would recommend sticking to realism where quicksand does slow you down and makes you sink only if you heavily move. Slow movement is normally the best way to escape quicksand.
Quicksand also only rarely "consumes" the whole person.

(After edit: )

In order to make it stand out of regular and suspicious sand. I'd make it 1 pixel smaller like farmland and/ or give it a darker tint.
And arrowheads.
molaría

Perhaps when struck by lightning, it becomes invigorated and serves as a secondary layer of defense. This augmentation is comparable to an enchantment, but made with smiting table, it grants the ability to launch attacking mobs backwards with a powerful force. Additionally, it functions as an additional level of protection for the wearer's armor.
WE NEED IT CAUSE COPPER FEELS SORTA USLESS
Copper already has enough use as it is.

Or they could add tin into the game and have it be used for some minor things like copper, and then allow us to mix tin with copper and create bronze tools and armor that are slightly better than iron.
that would be good but i would sorta not feel like minecraft
Yea why isn't there copper armor
good idea.
bro we do need copper armor
It would be kool if the texture of the armor, both in the inventory, and on the actual player oxidizes as the durability goes down, or something like that.

Also add to this post
I think more shields should be added
would be coppers and rubys

That seems more like something a shield spike smithing template should do with copper acting as one of the lower tiers for such a modification. Technically not a bad idea, if it weren't for the fact, that the shield currently is already overpowered as is, making it more powerful would only give it more ways in which to outmatch the rest of your gear. 

What I'm saying is, before any cool additions like this can be made to it, the basic shield first needs to be nerfed for them to be acceptable.
I think that will be a great idea 💡 because copper will have a useful feature.
pero que el escudo sea algo mas debil que el normal

This, actually isn’t that outlandish! Before we (humans) learned how to shape iron, we would always use copper, bronze, and even obsidian to make various kinds of tools. Back then, when people heard the word, “Shield” they imagined bronze and copper, not iron and titanium.
Make it round like a music disc not a perfect circle because that's not how Minecraft works
Just craft it like a normal shield but with copper instead of iron.
Yes to Corn!!! If seasoning could be added, we could have Grilled Corn. Hmmmmmmmm, how can we add Corn Flakes to the game?
Minecraft needs more crops because regular agriculture farming is fun but it needs more stuff added to it.
With this building a Farm gets more varied
Corn can be 2 blocks tall
Top secret ability to put it into a jukebox and it plays scatting noises(I love the band KoRn lol)
I think corn soup and pumpkin soup will be a good idea.
corn
Me parece excelente
maybe they should add rose quartz for the trim?
Amethyst already makes a pink color.

There's no ore to provide pink, dyes don't work as trims on metal armours it has to be an ore or crystal, and amethyst already offers a colour too close to pink. Very likely not to have any more trim colours.
We need a pink ore to make armor pink. Amethyst makes purple. We need a pink. Maybe a pink sapphire, rose quartz that can be found in the nether, pink feldspar, etc.
It would be cool if you could make rose quartz by combining redstone and normal quartz
Vote for previous beekeeper feedback.
No pls do not, for years the only thing villagers could do is trade, and I am sure MOJANG also wants to keep the plain old villagers
I'm down for this, but i'd also add on that we need more uses for honey then probably before this happens.
and short flowers to
Yeah they should glow
Agreed. IT IS IN THE NAME
Definitely
A light-up flower was the only reason I was interested in the sniffer.
If it doesn't glow, it makes no sense to call it a torchflower. And it's complicated to obtain, there should be something unique and special about it.
PLIS ADD IT!
100% agreed. The item only has one use, and a niche use at that.
Honestly it would be really nice to have another use for the echo shards

I was just thinking the same exact thing! Trims are crafted using ingots & crystals, and echo shards would definitely fit into this category given their crystalline appearance. This trim would most likely stand out, considering echo shards aren't a solid color like the other trim materials. I envision it as having the signature sculk pattern with a bluish glow. This could also help motivate players to explore the Ancient City further, and the uniqueness of the trim would be justified by the difficulty of the challenge of avoiding the Warden. Not to mention every armor trim template has a corresponding material except for the Ward armor trim template. There are 11 different trim templates, yet only 10 different materials you can use. Adding echo shards as a trim material would add a complement to the Ward armor template and bring both the material and template count to 11.
It would make the silence armor trim look like a warden more and would make it pop with other trims

Yea this would be an amazing addition who wouldn’t love to have their armour look like a deep start night or even make their armour look alive to make it spooky overall great idea this needs to be at least thought about

BRO THIS COULD ADD SO MUCH

GLOWING ARMOR TRIM CRAFTING RECIPIE?

ANIMATED ARMOR TRIM?

THERE R SO MANY POSSIBILITIES
Hmmm, how about instead of a menu, you could aim at that book and pick whichever book the crosshairs are on

A menu of the books we have in the shelves currently. With an anvil as the center piece. They could even reduced the enchantment cost or require bottle o enchanting. I just feel the anvil could use another useful use.
YOU GOT YOUR WISH ITS IN THE NEWEST SNAPSHOT
Maybe they'll heal slowly when they're dirty?
They should add the Oases promised in the biome vote, and have Camels spawn more frequently there.
This would be good because camels are not so powerful that they need to spawn only in desert villages.
that would be really cool for a new boss with a bossbar.also would make really cool hardcore minecraft youtube vids my names grayson cazzola
This one feels a bit clunky, but I could see it working. Maybe make it give Poison II for 15 seconds or something. I don’t like the badge idea though. Maybe a carapace piece or something.
Have them instead drop the spider legs and make them edible
Yeah, I think I’d be cool but with the badge I think you should also you get it’s head
